title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create an interactive form validator:

Write JavaScript that: 1. When the form is submitted, prevent default behavior 2. Get the username and email values 3. If username is empty, show error message 4. If email doesn't contain '@', show error message 5. If both valid, show success message
instructions:
Create an interactive form validator:

Write JavaScript that: 1. When the form is submitted, prevent default behavior 2. Get the username and email values 3. If username is empty, show error message 4. If email doesn't contain '@', show error message 5. If both valid, show success message

hints.text: Use if/else to check: username === '' and !email.includes('@')

commonMistakes.consequence: Using myFunction() with parentheses runs it immediately instead of on the event.
commonMistakes.correction: Pass the function reference without parentheses: button.addEventListener('click', myFunction);

commonMistakes.consequence: The form submits and the page reloads before your JavaScript code can run.
commonMistakes.correction: Call event.preventDefault() at the start of your submit handler to stop the default behavior.
